They were taken to custody for questioning and have since been bailed pending further police enquiries into the scam. The scam involves websites that claim to offer investment in new cryptocurrencies that could double in value. The new cryptocurrencies are sold with promised returns in cash when they are listed on major exchange websites. A boiler room operation based in London is suspected of making follow-up calls to victims to encourage further investment.

articles.summary: Zhimin Qian pleaded guilty to money laundering offences at Southwark Crown Court in September. Qian came to the UK in 2018 and tried to launder the proceeds through purchasing property with the help of Jian Wen. Jian Wen was jailed for her role in the scheme last year. The initial £5.1bn Bitcoin was seized after police raided Qian's home in Hamsptead in 2018, but she went on the run and was later arrested in York. A digital device containing the extra £67m was discovered in a concealed pocket of her trousers
